intro: Paraboea glabra, commonly known as the smooth paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Paraboea glabra is often found in coastal heathlands and is adapted to saline and well-drained conditions.
